manify.utils.visualization

Tools for visualization

Functions

S2_to_polar(X)

Convert S^2 (2-sphere) coordinates to polar coordinates.

hyperboloid_to_poincare(X)

Convert hyperboloid coordinates to Poincaré ball coordinates.

spherical_to_polar(X)

Convert spherical coordinates to polar coordinates.
manify.utils.visualization.S2_to_polar(X)

Convert S^2 (2-sphere) coordinates to polar coordinates.

Parameters:

X (Float[Tensor, 'n_points 3']) – (n_points, 3) Tensor, input coordinates on the 2-sphere.

Returns:

(n_points, 2) Tensor, coordinates in polar form (elevation, azimuth).

Return type:

polar_coords

manify.utils.visualization.hyperboloid_to_poincare(X)

Convert hyperboloid coordinates to Poincaré ball coordinates.

Parameters:

X (Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim']) – (n_points, n_dim) Tensor, input coordinates in the hyperboloid model.

Returns:

(n_points, n_dim_minus_1) Tensor, coordinates in the Poincaré ball model.

Return type:

poincare_coords

manify.utils.visualization.spherical_to_polar(X)

Convert spherical coordinates to polar coordinates.

Parameters:

X (Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim']) – (n_points, n_dim) Tensor, input coordinates in spherical form.

Returns:

, 1:]: (n_points, n_dim_minus_1) Tensor, coordinates in polar form.

Return type:

out[
